page.title: 09ALL SAINTS' CHURCH
page.content: The{church,}built by{The Green }in {1870}is unusual.It has{two naves,}the} second being built at a{higher level 34 years later to accommodate{Croxley {Paper Mill}workers.{Damage}was caused by{parachute mines}in 1940.Of{internal {interest}are a{roof}of{timber {vaulting;}the{stone font;}two year old {Bishops Throne;}statue of{Mary and {Jesus}commemorating{1984 Franciscan {Mission;}the{two altars;}modern {reredos}of beaten{bronze; kneelers embroidered with{flowers}of{The Green by{church members.}Regular meetings are held by{Young Wives',}Mothers' Union,{Male Choir,}Mens'Club,{Brownies Guides and{Mothers'}and{Toddlers' {Club}.The{Youth Section}makes an {annual pilgrimage}to{Saint Albans}on {Easter Monday.
